TEXT.TITLE: NORWEGIANS MAY HAVE SOLD MORE COMPUTERS TO USSR
TEXT.BODY: The Norwegian company <Konsgberg Vaapenfabrikk> (KV) may have sold more high technology defence equipment since an original deal in 1982, senior justice officials said. State prosecutor Tor-Aksel Busch told Reuters he had started fresh investigations into the state-owned arms firm which delivered computers to the Soviet Union in 1982 and 1983, used to make near-silent submarine propellers. "There may have been other deliveries of the same equipment since then," he said. Reuter
